image.altText: A close up shot of a man in a white shirt and silver tie, with a woman walking beside him.

props.synopsis: The criminal trial of celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright is underway in the NT Supreme Court with opening arguments, as he faces charges of attempting to pervert the course of justice in relation to a fatal chopper crash in 2022. Follow live.

title.children: Crown lays out Netflix star Matt Wright's alleged 'cover up' as trial begins

image.altText: A young girl lies with her head down in front of flower tributes.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Police say the cause of Kumanjayi White's death remains "undetermined", more than two months after he died in police custody at a Coles supermarket in Alice Springs.

title.children: Two months on, Kumanjayi White's cause of death in custody 'undetermined'

image.altText: A model walks a catwalk in an orange, pink and blue long dress with structured, lampshade sleeves and a wide brimmed, tipped hat

props.synopsis: This week marks the 10th anniversary of Darwin's biggest fashion show, Country to Couture, with the event shining a spotlight on some of Australia's finest First Nations artists.

title.children: Australia's finest First Nations' fashion hits Country to Couture runway

image.altText: a group of people standing in front of a house at night

props.synopsis: The family of Alice Springs man Gach Top have found him alive near an Aboriginal homeland a week after he was reported missing and days after the official search was called off.

title.children: Missing Alice Springs man found by family in 'miracle' after police called off search

image.altText: An airplane on the runway

props.synopsis: Nexus says the route linking Broome and Kununurra in the Kimberley with the Northern Territory's capital has become "financially unsustainable".

title.children: Calls for flight route to be regulated after Nexus pulls out

image.altText: A man in traditional dress.

props.synopsis: Like their Yolŋu hosts on Gumatj country, the stories, dance and regalia of Navajo, Comanche, Kiowa Sioux, Pueblo and Lakota nations in North America are intertwined with the land and natural environment.

title.children: In the red sand, two ancient cultures collide

image.altText: A woman in a t-shirt stands in front of a quick-flowing river in the remote Northern Territory.

props.synopsis: Scientists say one of the Northern Territory's most important water systems is experiencing "significant depletion".

title.children: NT's vast Cambrian Limestone Aquifer 'getting drier', research finds

image.altText: A young woman with long blonde wavy hair, red t-shirt, blurred greenery in the background, sun hitting back of her head

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory has the highest rate of sexual violence in Australia, with experts warning there's been a steep increase in children presenting with harmful sexualised behaviours.

title.children: The NT has the nation's highest rate of sexual violence, and it's worsening

image.altText: Child holds up colored sign that reads "we value our teachers"

props.synopsis: Today's strike action is expected to affect more than half a million students at about 1,200 state schools.

title.children: Queensland teachers striking over 'pretty dire situation'

image.altText: REA logo outside their office is of a red and white arrow going up

props.synopsis: The Australian share market rises to its highest level ever despite falls on Wall Street overnight, while REA Group and News Corp reveal significant profit increases, driven by more property listings. Follow live.

title.children: ASX climbs to record high as REA Group's profit surges

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Oops: ASX incorrectly pauses trading of TPG Telecom shares
Real estate rally continues on ASX
eSafety commissioner says YouTube 'turning blind eye' to child abuse

image.altText: A close up of Sussan Ley.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader has called for strong guardrails in place to protect Australian artists, musicians and news media from artificial intelligence. Follow live.

title.children: Sussan Ley calls for strong guardrails against AI

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Ley says government 'wishy-washy' about AI protections
Despite AUKUS and tariff doubts, State Department says US-Australia relations 'terrific'
Marles says government 'listening' to Australians on Gaza

image.altText: A redheaded man with a cropped beard walks past a brick-walled building

props.synopsis: The UK-based Charity Commission has cleared Prince Harry of bullying the chairperson of a charity he co-founded.

title.children: Prince Harry cleared of bullying charity boss

image.altText: Jim Chalmers img

props.synopsis: Productivity is an economic concept, but it should be fired by the universal human experience of being driven mad by unnecessary stuff that makes life harder.

title.children: Productivity starts in our kitchens and at the school gate

image.altText: A Japanese man wearing a dark suit and blue 'Nuke Free' cap, smiling while standing next to a waterway

props.synopsis: Thousands of people are set to gather to commemorate the 80th anniversary and the catastrophic impacts of the nuclear bombing of Japan's Hiroshima during World War II, including survivors who are calling for the world to be free of atomic weapons.

title.children: Eight decades after the Hiroshima nuclear bombing, survivors have one demand

image.altText: Melania in white with Donald Trump and Sean Diddy Combs. Combs is wearing white and holding a trophy.

props.synopsis: Music mogul Sean 'Diddy' Combs is seeking a pardon from US President Donald Trump, one of his lawyers has confirmed.

title.children: Sean 'Diddy' Combs seeking pardon from Trump

image.altText: A generic image of a female doctor talking to an unidentifiable male patient

props.synopsis: Health practitioners are increasingly using generative AI to help them record and summarise patient information. Here is what to know before you agree to them using it.

title.children: 'I'm choosing not to have it': Some people are saying no to Drs using AI

image.altText: A man in a helmet with no toes and fingers kicking an NFL ball in front of crowd

props.synopsis: In 2009, a teenaged Álex Sanchez became the first man with a physical disability to play in the top division of Spanish soccer. Despite a crude media frenzy, he looks back on it as his career's crowning achievement.

title.children: 'Like a monkey in the circus': Disability in mainstream sport

image.altText: Alex de Minaur is outstretched, hitting a backhand shot in a tennis match.

props.synopsis: Australian Alex de Minaur has been knocked out of the Canadian Open, going down in straight sets to American Ben Shelton in the quarterfinal.

title.children: De Minaur downed in quarterfinal of Canadian Open

image.altText: Peter Wright wins a ruck against Ned Moyle.

props.synopsis: The Gold Coast Suns' bid for their first finals appearance could come down to the last Wednesday of August, with the AFL locking in a time for the postponed Opening Round fixture.

title.children: Critical game in AFL finals race scheduled for a Wednesday night

image.altText: A woman in a cream woollen jumper and blue jeans stands at a railing with a younger woman in a cap and vest.

props.synopsis: Despite battling the drought herself, South Australian farmer Bridget Woods dipped into her own superannuation to buy fodder in bulk for others in her community who are struggling to feed livestock.

title.children: Farmer dips into her super to buy fodder in bulk for drought-hit community

image.altText: An external view of the Magistrates Court in Hobart.

props.synopsis: Patricia Iliev had not received medical attention since 1988 and was severely emaciated when she died in March 2021. A coronial inquest has found her long-term partner did not have any malicious intent.

title.children: Woman weighed 19kg when she died of starvation, inquest hears

image.altText: A mosquito on the skin of a person.

props.synopsis: Authorities are working to stop the spread of the disease in Southern China, with similar measures to those taken during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title.children: What to know about chikungunya as cases rise in South China

image.altText: cars splash water over the road as pedestrians try cross flooded roads and footpaths

props.synopsis: A wet finish to the year is increasingly favoured across Australia as a major climate driver emerges for the first time in three years.

title.children: Major climate driver signals wet August to December

image.altText: A group of people on the beach helping overturn a capsized speedboat

props.synopsis: A speedboat travelling from Nusa Penida to Bali has capsized after being struck by large waves, killing two people and leaving one missing.

title.children: Five Australians among 80 on boat that capsized in Bali

image.altText: A composite image with two pictures of a left hand with stitches from the index finger down to the wrist.

props.synopsis: A man who almost lost his hand in a machete attack at a Melbourne shopping centre has called into question security measures and is pleading for the government to act.

title.children: 'Not safe anywhere': Machete attacks instil fears in victims and witnesses

image.altText: A Centrelink/Medicare sign outside a branch.

props.synopsis: Almost a thousand jobseekers had their income support payments unlawfully terminated over two years, the federal watchdog has found, cautioning the breach likely had a "profound if not catastrophic" impact on vulnerable people.

title.children: 'Should have learned from Robodebt': Welfare payments unlawfully cut off

image.altText: Oskar Speck in his kayak

props.synopsis: Unemployed and seeking a better life, Oscar Speck pushed his kayak into the water of the Danube River and began paddling downriver. He didn't stop until he reached Australia.

title.children: After paddling 50,000km, Australian police arrested this German kayaker

image.altText: Sami looks out over his front porch at his home, with a pensive expression.

props.synopsis: Sami Muamar says the grief, anguish and mental toll of constant death have forced him to leave the job he loves.

title.children: Overwhelming grief of Gaza deaths forces principal from job he loves

image.altText: Close up image of musician ozzy osbourne while he is wearing blue circular sunglasses

props.synopsis: The death certificate was submitted by Osbourne's daughter, Aimée Osbourne, the New York Times reported.

title.children: Ozzy Osbourne died of a heart attack, death certificate shows

image.altText: A complex behind barbed wire in a sandy, desert area.

props.synopsis: The US has already deported eight men to South Sudan and another five to Eswatini. Here's what we know about the largely secretive deals the US is striking.

title.children: Rwanda becomes third African nation to accept US deportees under secretive deal

image.altText: The exterior of a small wooden building, with a veranda out the front, and eaves over the top.

props.synopsis: The Queensland Police Service reaffirms its commitment to divisional policing, but concerns remain about attracting young officers to rural areas.

title.children: Small Queensland communities push back against 'borderless policing'

image.altText: A man carries a victim, their feet are seen as they carry them out.

props.synopsis: Surging floodwaters and a torrent of mud have swept through a village in the northern Indian Himalayan state of Uttarakhand.

title.children: Village washed away and several missing after flash floods in India

image.altText: Two ibis on a fence.

props.synopsis: As we count down to discovering Australia's most underrated animal, there are plenty of worthy contenders that didn't make it into this year's top 10.

title.children: Australia has a love-hate relationship with the ibis, but the bird's not underrated

image.altText: Bill and Hillary Clinton walking through a procession at Donald Trump's second inauguration.

props.synopsis: Politicians on the House Oversight Committee also request the Justice Department provide them with files and depositions from its investigation into the deceased financier.

title.children: Clintons among figures subpoenaed in US congressional Epstein probe
